group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Collector(s) - Verbatim
item.name: recordedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence (collecting the specimen). The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.

item.label: Collector Number
item.name: recordNumber
item.description: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector’s number.

item.label: Collection Date - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimEventDate
item.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

item.label: Additional Collector Numbers
item.name: additionalRecordNumbers
item.description: Additional identifiers given to the collection.

item.label: Determiner(s) - Verbatim
item.name: identifiedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

item.label: Identification Date - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimDateIdentified
item.description: The verbatim date of identification noted on a label.

item.label: Annotation Date - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimDateAnnotated
item.description: The verbatim date of the creation of the annotation.

item.label: Annotator(s) - Verbatim
item.name: annotatedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, software agents, or organizations who provided the annotation. The verbatim text identifying who provided the annotation.

item.label: Event Remarks
item.name: eventRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the Event

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Scientific Name - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimScientificName
item.description: The full scientific name text string as it appears on the specimen label, with authorship and date information if shown.

item.label: Higher Classification - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimHigherClassification
item.description: Taxonomic names above the indicated scientific name.

item.label: Taxon Remarks
item.name: taxonRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

item.label: Common Name
item.name: vernacularName
item.description: A common or vernacular name.

item.label: Verbatim Field Notes
item.name: occurrenceRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

item.label: Identification Remarks
item.name: identificationRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the Identification.

item.label: Other Barcode/Accession Numbers
item.name: otherCatalogNumbers
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

item.label: Primary Label Footer
item.name: primaryLabelFooter
item.description: The verbatim text of the primary specimen label footer.

item.label: Primary Label Header
item.name: primaryLabelHeader
item.description: The verbatim text of the primary specimen label header.

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: Locality - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimLocality
item.description: The original textual description of the place.

item.label: Elevation - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimElevation
item.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

item.label: Coordinates - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimCoordinates
item.description: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Verbatim Determiner(s)
item.name: identifiedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

item.label: Identification Date - Verbatim
item.name: verbatimDateIdentified
item.description: The verbatim date of identification noted on a label.

group.item: description="Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in."

item.name: verbatimDateAnnotated

item.name: annotatedBy

item.name: eventRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the annotation event.

item.name: otherCatalogNumbers
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

item.name: catalogNumber
item.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

item.name: collectionCode
item.description: An identifier (preferably unique) assigned by the herbarium representing the collection.

item.name: occurrenceRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

item.label: Identification Remarks
item.name: identificationRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the Identification.

item.label: Verbatim Scientific Name
item.name: verbatimScientificName
item.description: The full scientific name text string as it appears on the specimen label, with authorship and date information if shown.

item.label: Verbatim Higher Classification
item.name: verbatimHigherClassification
item.description: Scientific Name on Image(Please contact expert)

item.label: Annotation Text
item.name: annotationRemarks
item.description: The verbatim wording on a specimen annotation.

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: Verbatim Locality
item.name: verbatimLocality
item.description: The original textual description of the place.

item.label: Verbatim Elevation
item.name: verbatimElevation
item.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

item.label: Verbtim Coordinates
item.name: verbatimCoordinates
item.description: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Herbarium Code
item.name: collectionCode
item.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

item.label: Previous Owning Institutions
item.name: previousOwners
item.description: Institution Codes representing previous ownership of specimen.

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Other Barcode/Accession Numbers
item.name: otherCatalogNumbers
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

item.label: Special Collection/Project Name
item.name: datasetName
item.description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Measurement Determined By
item.name: measurementDeterminedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

item.label: Measurement Determined Date
item.name: measurementDeterminedDate
item.description: The date on which the the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

item.label: Standardized Collection Date
item.name: eventDate
item.description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

item.label: Standardized Annotation Date
item.name: dateIdentified
item.description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

item.label: Standardized Primary Collector
item.name: primaryRecorder
item.description: The standardized name of the Primary Recorder (primary collector of the specimen).

item.label: Standardized Primary Determiner
item.name: primaryIdentifier
item.description: The standardized name of the Primary Identifier (primary determiner of the specimen).

item.label: Standardized Primary Annotator
item.name: primaryAnnotator
item.description: The authorized name of the Primary Annotator (located on the primary label or annotation label) verified using the Harvard University Herbaria Index of Botanists when possible.

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Individual Identifier
item.name: individualID
item.description: An identifier for an individual or named group of individual organisms represented in the Occurrence. Meant to accommodate resampling of the same individual or group for monitoring purposes. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a data set.

item.label: Verbatim Taxon Rank
item.name: verbatimTaxonRank
item.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

item.label: Taxon Rank
item.name: taxonRank
item.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Subgenus
item.name: subgenus
item.description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

item.label: Sex
item.name: sex
item.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Life Stage
item.name: lifeStage
item.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Authorship
item.name: scientificNameAuthorship
item.description: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

item.label: Phenology
item.name: reproductiveCondition
item.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Abundance
item.name: occurrenceStatus
item.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Measurement Value
item.name: measurementValue
item.description: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

item.label: Measurement Unit
item.name: measurementUnit
item.description: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

item.label: Measurement Type
item.name: measurementType
item.description: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Measurement Remarks
item.name: measurementRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.

item.label: Measurement Accurary
item.name: measurementAccuracy
item.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

item.label: Infraspecifc Epithet
item.name: infraspecificEpithet
item.description: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

item.label: Number of Individuals
item.name: dindividualCount
item.description: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

item.label: Identification References
item.name: identificationReferences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.

item.label: Identification Qualifier
item.name: identificationQualifier
item.description: A brief phrase or a standard term (cf., aff.) to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

item.label: Habitat
item.name: habitat
item.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred (includes soil information)

item.label: Genus
item.name: genus
item.description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

item.label: Specific Epithet
item.name: specificEpithet
item.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

item.label: Establishment
item.name: establishmentMeans
item.description: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Dynamic Properties
item.name: dynamicProperties
item.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

item.label: Habit
item.name: behavior
item.description: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Associated Taxa
item.name: associatedTaxa
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers or names of taxa and their associations with the Occurrence.

item.label: Associated Genetic Sequences
item.name: associatedSequences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

item.label: Associated References
item.name: associatedReferences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the Occurrence.

item.label: Annotation Type
item.name: basisOfAnnotation
item.description: The specific nature of the annotation record which indicates the type of annotation
item.options: Identification | Typification | Accession | Georeference |HumanObservation | MachineObservation | Unknown

item.label: Annotation References
item.name: annotationReferences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) referred to in the annotation.

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: State/Province
item.name: stateProvince
item.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

item.label: County/Department
item.name: county
item.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

item.label: Country ISO Code
item.name: countryCode
item.description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes.

item.label: Country
item.name: country
item.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

item.label: Municipality
item.name: municipality
item.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.

item.label: Location Remarks
item.name: locationRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes about the Location.

item.label: Locality
item.name: locality
item.description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

item.label: Minimum Elevation in Meters
item.name: minumumElevationInMeters
item.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

item.label: Maximum Elevation in Meters
item.name: maximumElevationInmeters
item.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

item.label: Verbatim Spatial Reference System
item.name: verbatimSRS
item.description: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Verbatim Longitude
item.name: verbatimLatitude
item.description: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

item.label: Verbatim Latitude
item.name: verbatimLongitude
item.description: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

item.label: Verbatim Coordinate System
item.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
item.description: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Geological Member
item.name: member
item.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the cataloged item was collected.

item.label: Water Body
item.name: waterBody
item.description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

item.label: Island Group
item.name: islandGroup
item.description: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

item.label: Island
item.name: island
item.description: The name of the island group in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

item.label: Geological Group
item.name: group
item.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the cataloged item was collected.

item.label: Geodetic Datum
item.name: geodeticDatum
item.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value unknown.

item.label: Geological Formation
item.name: formation
item.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the cataloged item was collected.

item.label: Geological Bed
item.name: bed
item.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the cataloged item was collected.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Measurement Determined By
item.name: measurementDeterminedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

item.label: Measurement Determined Date
item.name: measurementDeterminedDate
item.description: The date on which the the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

item.label: Standardized Annotation Date
item.name: dateIdentified
item.description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

item.label: Standardized Primary Determiner
item.name: primaryIdentifier
item.description: The standardized name of the Primary Identifier (primary determiner of the specimen).

item.label: Standardized Primary Annotator
item.name: primaryAnnotator
item.description: The authorized name of the Primary Annotator (located on the primary label or annotation label) verified using the Harvard University Herbaria Index of Botanists when possible.

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Individual Identifier
item.name: individualID
item.description: An identifier for an individual or named group of individual organisms represented in the Occurrence. Meant to accommodate resampling of the same individual or group for monitoring purposes. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a data set.

item.label: Verbatim Taxon Rank
item.name: verbatimTaxonRank
item.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

item.label: Taxon Rank
item.name: taxonRank
item.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Subgenus
item.name: subgenus
item.description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

item.label: Sex

item.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Life Stage
item.name: lifeStage
item.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.name: scientificNameAuthorship
item.description: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

item.label: Phenology

item.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.name: measurementValue

item.label: Measurement Unit
item.name: measurementUnit
item.description: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

item.label: Measurement Type
item.name: measurementType
item.description: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Measurement Remarks
item.name: measurementRemarks
item.description: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.

item.label: Measurement Accurary
item.name: measurementAccuracy
item.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

item.label: Infraspecifc Epithet
item.name: infraspecificEpithet
item.description: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

item.label: Number of Individuals
item.name: dindividualCount
item.description: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

item.label: Identification References
item.name: identificationReferences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.

item.label: Identification Qualifier
item.name: identificationQualifier
item.description: A brief phrase or a standard term (cf., aff.) to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

item.label: Genus
item.name: genus
item.description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

item.label: Specific Epithet
item.name: specificEpithet
item.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

item.label: Establishment
item.name: establishmentMeans
item.description: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Dynamic Properties
item.name: dynamicProperties
item.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

item.label: Habit
item.name: behavior
item.description: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Associated Genetic Sequences
item.name: associatedSequences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

item.label: Associated References
item.name: associatedReferences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the Occurrence.

item.label: Annotation Type
item.name: basisOfAnnotation
item.description: The specific nature of the annotation record which indicates the type of annotation
item.options: Identification | Typification | Accession | Georeference |HumanObservation | MachineObservation | Unknown

group.label: Where
group.description: Information about the location of a specimen collection event.

item.label: Verbatim Spatial Reference System
item.name: verbatimSRS
item.description: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Verbatim Longitude
item.name: verbatimLatitude
item.description: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

item.label: Verbatim Latitude
item.name: verbatimLongitude
item.description: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

item.label: Verbatim Coordinate System
item.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
item.description: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Geodetic Datum
item.name: geodeticDatum
item.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value unknown.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Standardized Annotation Date
item.name: dateIdentified
item.description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Annotation Type
item.name: basisOfAnnotation
item.description: The specific nature of the annotation record which indicates the type of annotation
item.options: Identification | Typification | Accession | Georeference |HumanObservation | MachineObservation | Unknown

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: Continent
item.name: continent
item.description: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names or the ISO 3166 Continent code
item.options: Africa | Antarctica | Asia | Australia | Europe | North America | South America

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Georeferenced By
item.name: georeferencedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) the Location.

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Taxonomic Status
item.name: taxonomicStatus
item.description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the expert’s opinion.
item.options: accepted | invalid | synonym | homotypic synonym | heterotypic synonym | misapplied name

item.label: Basionym
item.name: originalNameUsage
item.description: The taxon name, with authorship and date information if known, as it originally appeared when first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode. The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

item.label: Nomenclatural Status
item.name: nomenclaturalStatus
item.description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

item.label: Protologue Publication
item.name: namePublishedIn
item.description: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

item.label: Disposition
item.name: disposition
item.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Associated Records
item.name: dwc:associatedOccurrences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

item.label: Type Designation
item.name: typeDesignation
item.description: Designation as a particular kind of type, indicating the subset from a set of (usually duplicate) specimens serving as the basis for the description of a taxon.

item.label: Identification Status
item.name: identificationStatus
item.description: Indicates if the associated identification is original or subsequent and current (newest) or superseded.

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: Georeference Verification Status
item.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
item.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Georeference Sources
item.name: georeferenceSources
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

item.label: Georeference Remarks
item.name: georeferenceRemarks
item.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

item.label: Decimal Longitude
item.name: decimalLogitude
item.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

item.label: Decimal Latitude
item.name: decimalLatitude
item.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

item.label: Coordinates
item.name: coordinatePrecision
item.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Georeferenced By
item.name: georeferencedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) the Location.

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Taxonomic Status
item.name: taxonomicStatus
item.description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the expert’s opinion.
item.options: accepted | invalid | synonym | homotypic synonym | heterotypic synonym | misapplied name

item.label: Basionym
item.name: originalNameUsage
item.description: The taxon name, with authorship and date information if known, as it originally appeared when first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode. The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

item.label: Nomenclatural Status
item.name: nomenclaturalStatus
item.description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

item.label: Protologue Publication
item.name: namePublishedIn
item.description: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

item.label: Disposition
item.name: disposition
item.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Associated Records
item.name: associatedOccurrences
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

item.label: Type Designation
item.name: typeDesignation
item.description: Designation as a particular kind of type, indicating the subset from a set of (usually duplicate) specimens serving as the basis for the description of a taxon.

item.label: Identification Status
item.name: identificationStatus
item.description: Indicates if the associated identification is original or subsequent and current (newest) or superseded.

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: Georeference Verification Status
item.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
item.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Georeference Sources
item.name: georeferenceSources
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

item.label: Georeference Remarks
item.name: georeferenceRemarks
item.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

item.label: Decimal Longitude
item.name: decimalLogitude
item.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

item.label: Decimal Latitude
item.name: decimalLatitude
item.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

item.label: Coordinates
item.name: coordinatePrecision
item.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about who made a collection and when it was made.

item.label: Owning Institution Code
item.name: ownerInstitutionCode
item.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

item.label: Institution Code
item.name: institutionCode
item.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

item.label: Georeferenced By
item.name: georeferencedBy
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) the Location.

group.label: What
group.description: Text that describes the plant specimen and the habitat it was found in.

item.label: Type Status
item.name: typeStatus
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

item.label: Taxonomic Status
item.name: taxonomicStatus
item.description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the expert’s opinion.
item.options: accepted | invalid | synonym | homotypic synonym | heterotypic synonym | misapplied name

item.label: Scientific Name
item.name: scientificName
item.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.

item.label: Previous Identifications
item.name: previousIdentification
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous assignments of names to the Occurrence.

item.label: Related Preparations
item.name: preparation
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.

item.label: Division
item.name: phylum
item.description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

item.label: Order
item.name: order
item.description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

item.label: Nomenclatural Status
item.name: nomenclaturalStatus
item.description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

item.label: Kingdom
item.name: kingdom
item.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

item.label: Higher Classification
item.name: higherClassification
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names terminating at the rank immediately superior to the taxon referenced in the taxon record. Recommended best practice is to order the list starting with the highest rank and separating the names for each rank with a semi-colon

item.label: Disposition
item.name: disposition
item.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Class
item.name: class
item.description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

item.label: Kind of Specimen
item.name: basisOfRecord
item.description: The specific nature of the data record - a subtype of the dcterms:type. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Darwin Core Type Vocabulary

group.label: Where
group.description: Text about the location where a specimen was collected including geographic names and coordinates.

item.label: Higher Geography
item.name: higherGeography
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the locality term.

item.label: Georeference Verification Status
item.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
item.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

item.label: Georeference Sources
item.name: georeferenceSources
item.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

item.label: Georeference Remarks
item.name: georeferenceRemarks
item.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

item.label: Decimal Longitude
item.name: decimalLogitude
item.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

item.label: Decimal Latitude
item.name: decimalLatitude
item.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

item.label: Coordinates
item.name: coordinatePrecision
item.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

group.label: Who and When
group.description: Data about a person or institution who holds a collection.

item.label: Owning Institution Code
item.name: ownerInstitutionCode
item.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.
